funFacts: The English word ‘Safari’ comes directly from the Swahili word ‘safari’ meaning ‘journey’.
About 30–35% of modern Swahili vocabulary is borrowed from Arabic due to centuries-long coastal trade.
Google Translate added Swahili in 2009, making it one of the first African languages on the platform.
Swahili has 18 noun classes; this complex agreement system is a major pain-point for machine translation.
‘Hakuna Matata’, popularized by Disney’s The Lion King, literally means ‘there are no worries’ in Swahili.
